importantArticles.headline: Buying stock in great companies when they are dealing with some short-term issue that creates stock price weakness can set investors up for big gains down the road. importantArticles.headline: (Reuters) -British pharmaceutical giant GlaxoSmithKline and rival Pfizer have agreed to end a lawsuit that alleged Pfizer's respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) vaccine Abrysvo violated GSK's patent rights in its competing RSV shot Arexvy, according to a Thursday filing in Delaware federal court.  GSK and Pfizer said in the filing that they would dismiss the case with prejudice, which means it cannot be refiled.  GSK, Pfizer and Moderna have developed RSV shots approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, with GSK's Arexvy responsible for the majority of U.S. RSV vaccine sales.
importantArticles.title: GSK resolves patent lawsuit against Pfizer over RSV vaccines
